SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.api.animatedblock

Interface IAnimationHook

All Known Implementing Classes:
AudioAnimationHook
public interface IAnimationHook
Represents a hook into an Animation.

The animation hook works very similarly to the IAnimatedBlockHook. The main difference is that instead of hooking into the animated blocks themselves, they hook into the animation.

The animation hook allows its hooks to override methods to perform actions on specific events, such as onAnimationCompleted() or onPostAnimationStep().

To use animation hooks, you need to register a subclass of IAnimationHookFactory with the AnimationHookManager. An instance of this class can be obtained using IAnimatedArchitecturePlatform.getAnimationHookManager().

Example usage: 


 private void registerMyAnimationHookFactory(IAnimatedArchitecturePlatform animatedArchitecturePlatform)
 {
     animatedArchitecturePlatform.getAnimationHookManager().registerFactory(
         animation -> new MyAnimationHook(animation));
 }

 private static final class MyAnimationHook implements IAnimationHook<IAnimatedBlock>
 {
     private final Animation<IAnimatedBlock> animation;

     MyAnimationHook(Animation<IAnimatedBlock> animation)
     {
         this.animation = animation;
     }

     @Override
     public String getName()
     {
         return "MyAnimationHook";
     }

     @Override
     public void onPostAnimationStep()
     {
         // Some code that is executed after each step of the animation.
     }
 }

The factory receives an Animation object and is called when a new animation is started by the IAnimator. Whether the factory returns a new hook or reuses an existing one is up to the implementation. If the factory returns null, the hook will not be registered for the given animation.

You can refer to the animation hook used by the audio system to see a full implementation: AudioAnimationHook.

Author:
Pim

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns:
      The name of this hook. Used for logging purposes.

    • onPreAnimationStep

      default void onPreAnimationStep()
      Executed before a new animation step is applied.

      Note that this may never happen if the animation is skipped.

    • onPostAnimationStep

      default void onPostAnimationStep()
      Executed after a new animation step is applied.

      Note that this may never happen if the animation is skipped.

    • onPrepare

      default void onPrepare()
      Executed right before the animation starts.

      Note that this may never happen if the animation is skipped.

    • onAnimationEnding

      default void onAnimationEnding()
      Executed when the animation is in the finishing phase.

      Note that this may never happen if the animation is skipped.

    • onAnimationAborted

      default void onAnimationAborted()
      Executed when the animation has been aborted.

      This is not part of the normal animation pipeline. It may occur when the plugin stops, or when the chunks for the animation are being unloaded.

    • onAnimationCompleted

      default void onAnimationCompleted()
      Executed when the animation finishes.
